result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristopher Kyle Klein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristopher Kyle Klein

11:02 AM Defendant Kristopher Kyle Klein in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives his right to an attorney. Defendant pleads no contest. Court finds defendant guilty. Court orders 18 days jails and costs due within 60 days. Sentence credit 18 days.
Pro se
